file_content.text: The nekghouls' deaths were a loss to science... but frankly, I would have done the same thing.
It must have been hard to spare the nekghouls. But studying that warren will teach us a lot.
The new species has a lair that looks like an ex-power plant. And it's got--get this--crude, recent construction.
Mola, the fact that they can build a ladder is the least of our worries.
Day two, minute eleven--one of the new species pushes away the others in order to get at a food source.
But he pushes them without touching them. It's very clear, there is no contact.
The new species can use the Force.
Rakghouls know only aggression and fear. That's a recipe for the dark side.
That's disturbing.
That's what we're afraid of. We're no experts in the Force, but this new species seems more psychotic than predatory.
The order will want to know of this... as well as a great many scientists.
Now that's a discovery.
We'll publish our findings soon enough, but right now we have greater concerns.
Glad we didn't find this out during an attack.
At least we know now.
That was the base commander's opinion, too. And we still don't know the most critical information.
So what you're saying is, if I have property on Taris, sell it all now.
That's not good!
Depends on our colonies' chances. We've alerted the base commander and the rest of the garrison.
But the old kind... they never could, right?
How is that possible?
There is a widespread theory that the rakghoul plague was an artificial creation of the so-called "dark side."
Thus, their evolution deviates from the standard model. But it leaves us with some disturbing possibilities.
There's no other explanation?
We're sure. Obviously, we've alerted the base commander and the rest of the garrison.
We don't know if just one of the new species is Force sensitive, or all of them. If it's all of them, the garrison is considering evacuation.
This is the largest threat facing Taris. We need eyes in that rakghoul lair!
I will risk it to protect the colonies.
Dangerous, but necessary.
Pitch-black cave, multiple dark side Force users, no backup. Where do I sign?
I'm in.
Excellent idea. Just let me update my will.
Crazy, but I'm up for it.
It's the best plan we've got. The lair you want is an old power plant deep in rakghoul territory.
This could be easier than you think. An intelligent species might try to communicate.
Maybe they'll be reasonable.
Don't think I'd take that bet.
All right. The lair you want is deep in rakghoul territory. Some of the power plant structure is still recognizable.
I'll fit you with a transmitter so we can see what you see. Get close enough to film the creatures--but if one notices you, do what you have to.
This new species hasn't harmed us yet. Until it does, this is speculation.
I won't do it. [Refuse quest]
That's a point to consider. Thank you, Master Jedi.
This sounds like a game of tease-the-rancor. It's a game that doesn't end well.
Not wise. [Refuse quest]
If you want me to assess the threat, I can do that from here. They're a threat!
No way. [Refuse quest]
All right. We'll have to beg the base commander to commit troops to this. Not that they'll stand a chance....
You're back! Let's cue up that footage and see the rakghouls.
Calm down, Mola. I think some thanks are in order.
Yes, of course. We'd never go into the warrens, even with an escort... this wouldn't have happened without you.
The swarms were pretty thick in that warren. You'll get something you can use.
There were ghouls galore.
If the rakghouls are a danger, they must be confronted.
It is simply my way.
Rakghouls aren't dangerous... well, not with a blaster bolt in their head.
Don't worry about it.
You could have mentioned that before I left.
Would have been good to know!
I'm sorry, this is a chance for a doctorate... for a significant contribution to xenozoology and the colonist effort. I got excited.
And trust me when I say every Tarisian colonist could end up owing you their lives.
It's nothing.
If this works out, we'll be sure to credit you in the journal of sentientology.
Mola, how about phrasing it like, "Tarisian colonists probably all owe you their lives"?
You don't think that's more abstract?
I'll upload the footage. Let's talk after we've looked it over.
When you get into the warren, try not to blast the multi-recorder.
This is not a grooming behavior. That's tool use at the very least.
I know that and you know that, I'm just saying neither the university nor the garrison--nevermind, we have company.
Hi, I'm Mola Haxtor, this is Professor Vraal, we're applied xenozoologists. Could you settle something for us?
Nice to see some new faces. I'm Mola Haxtor, this is Professor Vraal. We're xenozoologists. Could you settle something for us?
I'm sorry... "xenozoologist"?
You're what kind of zoologist?
We study alien life-forms. On Taris, that pretty much means rakghouls.
If it's fast.
There's better people than me to ask about... whatever you just said.
I'm no expert.
Actually, we're looking for an average person's reaction.
Come look at this. We implanted a recording device in a rakghoul and released him. This image is from the footage of his warren.
It looks like a new species of rakghoul. Taller, meaner, dominates normal raks, and when it was being recorded, it, uh....
It reached over and shut the transmitter off.
I didn't think rakghouls were that smart.
Can they do that?
They may not be, but the evidence is compelling. If he were playing with a switch, he'd flick it on again. He hasn't.
If these ghouls are capable of tool use, our colony defenses need to be changed. But we need the footage off our device to be sure.
You seem afraid that they're sentient--that's the larger threat.
I'm sensing fear.
That means smart. Smart means dangerous. Is that where we're going?
That's not good!
Exactly. I told you it wasn't so hard, Vraal.
So he wanted a little privacy with Lady Rakghoul. Why does this matter?
I'm not impressed.
Because rakghouls barely use tools. They're not sentient. If this new species can reason, we have to change our colony defenses.
This is why we need someone--you--to find our rakghoul and extract his recording device.
So how does this affect me?
See? No one intuitively grasps that smart ghouls mean we must change the colony's defenses. If we take this to the garrison, they won't get it.
Then we need more convincing footage. We need that camera off our rakghoul and back in our hands.
Besides the obvious academic prestige, it is essential that the Republic find out how dangerous this new species is.
The last thing we want are organized rakghouls. I'll dig up your device.
I'll check out that lair.
Say no more. I'll go.
Thank you. Obviously, the footage and your life are top priority. Find the rak, kill the rak, grab the camera.
And run.
Be careful. It's extremely unlikely this species evolved since the bombardment.
Either it was under extreme pressure to diverge... or it had help.
I'm not playing fetch so you can make a nature documentary.
Not worth it. [Refuse quest]
But the scientific value, the discovery of a new sentient life-form--
We made our case, Mola. We'll just have to convince the garrison.
Me? I'm here for fieldwork. Taris has some unique opportunities for xenozoologists.
